answers.answer: me too..I was thinking the same thing :(
I'm on a diet and I'm frustrated because I'm worried I won't be gaining enough weight and it's annoying.

I am I have been doing my diet since 26 weeks I'm now 37 weeks it is hard and sometimes I'm hungry but I think of the baby and I make it through.I did lose a few pounds in the beginning but it's nothing to worry about because you're baby gains the most in your last few weeks of pregnancy... Which is where I'm at now and have gained a few pounds my Baby is almost 7 pounds
Are you going to have the baby early because of the gestational diabetes and I'm worried alot about my blood sugar :( it's been low but I'm fixing it slowly

I go to the doc on Thursday so I'll see than but my doc is not concerned my numbers have been good and the baby is at a good weight so not sure if I will get induced. But if you stick to it you and the baby will be fine don't worry about having baby early Just focus on eating right and keeping those blood sugar levels low because you don't want to get put on insulin
Thank you! Mine have been low when I 1st got on the diet they were to low
I'm 17 and 33+ 2 weeks and I'm a ftm and I am not allowed to eat any sugar because I'm borderline gestational diabetic. It's so hard but I know it's best for my son.
Dang I'm sorry it's so hard I only have 100 days left I just hate going through this and I'm sorry yall have to go through it

question: Have to go on a diet cause of gestational diabetes?  How hard was it?
title: anyone
